content.description: Contender for the 3 most pleasant fingerlocks on a boulder in Southwest Montana. Sweet pulls on sinker locks up the steep north face of the Jedi boulder. For extra fun, crouch start down and right in the cave on tasty incuts, then crimp up and left into the start.
content.location: Obvious finger crack on the north face of the Jedi boulder.

content.description: Crimp ladder up middle of the sunny side of the Jedi Boulder.
content.location: Original line was a stand start from two glassy opposing sidepulls. K. Macartney put up a sit start that is the new standard line. Starts with left hand on good incut crimp and right on bad shallow sloper. Big move to sidepulls and drop in for close compression of the stand. Follow crimps to top.

content.description: Easy climbing to awkward stem/trickery to a committing jump to lip. There is a lower start in the pit that goes a couple grades harder.
content.location: Start on obvious rail on the left most steep side of Jedi boulder.

content.description: Dynamic big span moves on good holds. Crux involves left hand in the deep vertical mail slot, right on two finger square spike, make wingspan move to good right hand hold. Make committing move to lip. Easier if you are tall.
content.location: Start on obvious rail on right side of steep face of Jedi boulder.

content.description:
Start on the far left, flat north face of the Jedi Boulder with a left toe hook on the arÃªte and two right facing crimps. The right foot could be anything, depending on height, but there is one obvious sloper.

Dyno to the chalky jug rail, then choose your adventure. I went right to finish on Skywalker (Bring the Hate + Skywalker = Anakin).
content.location: Left most climb on the north face of Jedi Boulder.
